content: According to Newsmax.com there is a new book out featuring interviews with female soldiers re; sexual assault and rapes. This same thing happened with females in the Israeli military. Is anyone surprised? I sure wish it were not so. Helen Benedict the author and the book came out in the US on Wed. The title is "the Lonely Soldier: the private war of women in Iraq." The author interviewed 40 women. The article goes on to say that up to 79% of females since WW2 have been sexually mistreated in the military. Perhaps combat duty ought be left to males would be my conclusion. Men ought to view females as respected and tender human beings. The Bra burners of the 60's and 70's now reap the whirwind of their equality bullsquat. They wanted it and they got it much to American shame. This message has been edited. Last edited by: 5727609, Fri 17 April 2009 04:34 PM

title: Female soldiers raped/assaulted

content: I was at the V.A. Hospital twice this week, Tuesday and Today Friday) And saw the posters on Tuesday about anyone who was abused or harrassed, or even raped, coming forward for whatever help they thought they would need....It made me deeply ashamed. I felt that the danger to women would be rape if they were captured as those 28 who were during G.W.1 were, by their Iraqi captors, something the government kept pretty quiet about, then, and now. I always felt the true danger to our troops of both sexes by women being allowed in combat would be the tendency of the males to be over protective of the women in their command with them, and lose sight of the mission requirements and get themselves, and those women, killed for it. I never in all my born days, thought I would see such a shameful poster on the walls of a V.A. hospital, concerning our returning female veterans and their possible abuse, at the hands of those who should have been their comrades in arms....not their rapists!!
reply: I was at the V.A. content: Hi, my name is Catherine and I plan on joining the military. I think it's horrible that any women is raped. They have the right to fight in the military as the men do without being raped. I plan to get my degree and help military women who have been raped and abused. I want to help them get better. For all the women in the military out there who have been raped here is someone you can talk to and her name is Sorry, it is not a good idea to post someones personal information on a Forum read worldwide. If someone wants the information about who and how to contact, they can add you as a friend, and then email you for the information. To all the victim's out there we are with you we care. Sincerely Catherine Powell This message has been edited. Last edited by: Silent_Surface, Mon 27 April 2009 03:09 PM

content: I think rape in the context we're discussing here is about power AND sex. The rules to forbid sex in this context don't work, never have and never will. Of course discipline is necessary but having a fully fucntional sexual organ in a young, healthy body is completely different than that person having a fully functional M-16. I don't know the complete answer but I know what we're doing now isn't it.

content: Hi, my name is Catherine and I plan on joining the military. I think it's horrible that any women is raped. They have the right to fight in the military as the men do without being raped. I plan to get my degree and help military women who have been raped and abused. I want to help them get better. For all the women in the military out there who have been raped here is someone you can talk to and her name is Sorry, it is not a good idea to post someones personal information on a Forum read worldwide. If someone wants the information about who and how to contact, they can add you as a friend, and then email you for the information. To all the victim's out there we are with you we care. Sincerely Catherine Powell This message has been edited. Last edited by: Silent_Surface, Mon 27 April 2009 03:09 PM

content: I think rape in the context we're discussing here is about power AND sex. The rules to forbid sex in this context don't work, never have and never will. Of course discipline is necessary but having a fully fucntional sexual organ in a young, healthy body is completely different than that person having a fully functional M-16. I don't know the complete answer but I know what we're doing now isn't it.

title: Female soldiers raped/assaulted

content: According to Newsmax.com there is a new book out featuring interviews with female soldiers re; sexual assault and rapes. This same thing happened with females in the Israeli military. Is anyone surprised? I sure wish it were not so. Helen Benedict the author and the book came out in the US on Wed. The title is "the Lonely Soldier: the private war of women in Iraq." The author interviewed 40 women. The article goes on to say that up to 79% of females since WW2 have been sexually mistreated in the military. Perhaps combat duty ought be left to males would be my conclusion. Men ought to view females as respected and tender human beings. The Bra burners of the 60's and 70's now reap the whirwind of their equality bullsquat. They wanted it and they got it much to American shame. This message has been edited. Last edited by: 5727609, Fri 17 April 2009 04:34 PM

title: Female soldiers raped/assaulted

content: I was at the V.A. Hospital twice this week, Tuesday and Today Friday) And saw the posters on Tuesday about anyone who was abused or harrassed, or even raped, coming forward for whatever help they thought they would need....It made me deeply ashamed. I felt that the danger to women would be rape if they were captured as those 28 who were during G.W.1 were, by their Iraqi captors, something the government kept pretty quiet about, then, and now. I always felt the true danger to our troops of both sexes by women being allowed in combat would be the tendency of the males to be over protective of the women in their command with them, and lose sight of the mission requirements and get themselves, and those women, killed for it. I never in all my born days, thought I would see such a shameful poster on the walls of a V.A. hospital, concerning our returning female veterans and their possible abuse, at the hands of those who should have been their comrades in arms....not their rapists!!
reply: I was at the V.A. I never in all my born days, thought I would see such a shameful poster on the walls of a V.A. hospital, concerning our returning female veterans and their possible abuse, at the hands of those who should have been their comrades in arms....not their rapists!!

content: I think rape in the context we're discussing here is about power AND sex. The rules to forbid sex in this context don't work, never have and never will. Of course discipline is necessary but having a fully fucntional sexual organ in a young, healthy body is completely different than that person having a fully functional M-16. I don't know the complete answer but I know what we're doing now isn't it.
